subhead: As peace talks with Washington continue, the Kremlin is trying to convince the world that a Russian victory is inevitable, even though its army is advancing slowly and suffering heavy losses.

Sarkozy casts himself as new Dreyfus in prison memoir
subhead: The former president claims in his new book that he is an innocent victim of a political trial. His testimony also reveals the extraordinary privileges he received during his time in prison.

title: EU decides to impose €3 tax on small parcels to tackle Chinese imports
subhead: The European Union will impose a temporary €3 tax on small parcels entering the bloc starting in July of next year, finance ministers agreed Friday. The move is designed to counter Chinese platforms AliExpress, Temu and Shein, which European retailers say do not comply with EU rules.

title: The French studio behind a viral Christmas ad
subhead: A Christmas commercial created by the French animation studio Illogic Studios for the Intermarché supermarket chain has racked up tens of millions of views on social media.

title: Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
subhead: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

title: Ukraine ready to consider Donbas demilitarized zone in concession to end war
subhead: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, tells Le Monde that the zone would require Ukrainian and Russian forces to both pull back from the front line.

title: How the Israeli army is razing the part of Gaza it is supposed to withdraw from
subhead: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.
byline: Elsa Delmas,  Marie Jo Sader and  Mellit Derre
